page.title: 15KEMBLE RAILWAY
page.content: In 1841,{I.K.Brunel}built the { {Swindon - Cheltenham}line. The local squire insisted that the railway had to go underground through Kemble so a tunnel was built 500 yards long. A special Act of Parliament was needed before{Kemble Station}was built because the squire's daughter opposed it. The station is by "The Tavern". There used to be an old platform by the side of it and one of the lines went to {Cirecester}and one to{ {Tetbury.}A lot of commuters park their cars at the station and go to work in{ {Swindon}or{London. { }The station is very attractive and well-cared for. It has been judged the best kept small station in the West of England for the last two years.
